cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi ENE of Daytona Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing NNW today, then turning north tonight while paralleling the southeast U.S. coastline toward South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the South Carolina coast (around Charleston area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Surf City NC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Sebastian Inlet to Cocoa Beach FL; Hurricane Warning Cocoa Beach FL to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northeast Florida coast north of Sebastian Inlet through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds with hurricane-force gusts likely early Friday, gradually easing by Friday evening
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 feet of inundation possible along the Brevard/Volusia coast including Port Canaveral if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches possible with locally higher amounts up to 15 inches, creating risk of flash flooding around the port area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands
